info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 6:21AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL ALLEGHENY AND NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND COUNTIES THROUGH 645 AM EDT... At 620 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Side Pittsburgh, or over Pittsburgh, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, Monroeville, McKeesport, Shaler Township, Plum, West Mifflin, North Side Pittsburgh, and Baldwin. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 48 and 68. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 67 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
